articles.author: Lloyd Burnard
articles.title: From cleaning boots to a maiden Test century: Why new Proteas star Erwee is 'a coach's dream'
articles.description: Sarel Erwee has had to be patient, waiting for his opportunity to play Test cricket, but he is now set for an extended run at the top of the South African order.
articles.content:
• Proteas coach Mark Boucher is thrilled for Sarel Erwee, who took his Test chance against New Zealand.
  • "Good things happen to good people," Boucher said.
  • Erwee carded a maiden… [+2628 chars]

articles.author: Avani Dias, Som Patidar
articles.title: Australia's cricket team is in Pakistan for the first time in 24 years. Here's how local authorities plan to keep them safe
articles.description: With Australia's cricket team in Pakistan for the first time in decades, the country is closing roads, surrounding their bus with armed troops and covering them from above with helicopters to keep them safe.
articles.content:
In Pakistan, cricket is practically a religion. 
The nation has bred some of the world's best players, Prime Minister Imran Khan was a World Cup-winning captain and generations of kids play the game… [+4916 chars]

articles.title: What we learned from watching the 1992 World Cup final in full again | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.description: Wides, lbw calls, swing - plenty of things were different in white-ball cricket back then | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.content: Last week, we at ESPNcricinfo did something we have been thinking of doing for eight years now: pretend-live ball-by-ball commentary for a classic cricket match. We knew the result, yes, but we tried… [+6823 chars]
